items.content_html:
Description

Update react documentation link to https://react.dev/

Motivation

I noticed that MDN still use the old documentation for ReactJS, so I decided to switch to the newer documentation. This is because the old documentation https://reactjs.org/ will redirect to https://react.dev/ at some point. I just redirect some of it that quite match the content.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update react documentation link

items.content_html: • fixes #14273
items.title: fix: remove an irrelevant section

items.content_html:
We are using "local/global" terminology here as an analogy which I think may be adding some confusion. We already define coordinate systems under "screen" and "client" coordinates which aligns with current specs, so I would remove the ambiguity and refer to those definitions only instead.

Fixes #28676
items.title: chore(API): Clarify local/global coordinates refer to client / screen coords

items.content_html:
• fixes #28366

The example is confusing because:

  • Same values 25% 25% have been used for both the offsets.
  • Use of opacity in the animation makes it hard to find where exactly the animation started.
  • It is obvious to think the first value sets the animation start, without knowing the inset is offset for the scrollport.
items.title: fix: better explain animation-timeline view() function

items.content_html:
The current sentence -
"The first and third values are keyword value defining X and Y."

  • is edited to have an 's' at the end of "value".

Also edited -
"The first value and third values one of the keyword values top, left, bottom, right. If left or right are given here, then this defines X. If top or bottom are given, then this defines Y and the other keyword value defines X."

  • to fix errors and make the document more readable.

Description

Fix typos and grammar mistakes making the document more readable.

Motivation

I'm making these changes to help contribute to mdn's documentation. I care about the ease of readability of the web and screen reader's accessibility. Fixing these errors will help all that I've mentioned.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix grammar mistakes/typos

Description

Make it clear that if an element has no parent, calling getRootNode on it will return the element itself. Also provide a simple example for this case.

Motivation

Make it more clear to readers.

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests

items.title: Clarify getRootNode can return the element itself

items.content_html:
Suggestion from Estelle to add link to HTMLImageElement from <img> in See Also section. Spellchecker additions in parallel. I had intended to get this into #28698 but I was too slow to amend the open PR.

spellchecker:
Allowing 'Navigations' based on https://www.w3.org/TR/referrer-policy/

This document describes how an author can set a referrer policy for documents they create, and the impact of such a policy on the Referer HTTP header for outgoing requests and navigations.
items.title: chore(html): Add link to HTMLImageElement from img element See Also, spellchecker

items.content_html:
â€¦normative changes related to fractionalDigits option, clarify usage in general

Description

  • Updated examples to reflect tc39/proposal-intl-duration-format#150
  • Made existing examples much more comprehensive/accurate

Motivation

Recent normative changes have altered the behaviour of `fractionalDigits. Intl.DurationFormat.format() now defaults to displaying however many digits are necessary to display all components, rather than defaulting to 0 fractional digits displayed.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to tc39/proposal-intl-duration-format#150
items.title: substantial revision to Intl.DurationFormat.format

items.content_html:
This PR does two things related to Markdownlint:

  • Bumps markdownlint-cli2 from 0.8.1 to 0.9.0
    • In doing so, markdownlint is also updated from 0.29.0 to 0.30.0. In previous versions, the no-space-in-code rule was broken, but since we have legitimate use for spaces within inline code, I've disabled the rule.
  • Separates the config into two different files, .markdownlint-cli2.jsonc and .markdownlint.jsonc.
    • This mimicks the structure of the configuration files in the translated content repository, and will let us better override configuration in subfolders if we need to.
    • An additional benefit is that editors can take advantage of the Markdownlint config schema to suggest autocompletions this way.
items.title: Bump markdownlint-cli2 to 0.9.0; split configuration file

Adding an embedded example showing the effect of contain-intrinsic-size in elements with vertical scroll.

Related issues and pull requests:

  • Parent issue #28292
  • Relnote #28522

Bugzilla:

items.title: relnote(117): examples for 'auto none' in 'contain-intrinsic-size' CSS prop

items.content_html:
Description

This PR mainly switch to workflow_call instead of workflow_run event to prevent calling "PR review companion" when not necessary.

To achieve this, and take this opportunity to improve the code, the following changes were made:

  1. Use pull_request_target event instead of pull_request, with the former event, the GITHUB_TOKEN has write permissions and the jobs could access GitHub secrets (we are using secrets to store the AK, SK).
  2. Set the permissions of the "tests" job to read-all to avoid accidental writes to the repo.
  3. Run the "PR review companion" as a spread job (named "review") in "PR test", so we could use if condition to skip unnecessary runs,
    Set the permissions of "review" job to write-all, so the deployer could create comment in PRs.
  4. Use actions/download-artifact instead of js scripts, as the shared "PR review companion" workflow is a spread job in "PR test" now, we could use this action to download and unzip artifacts (simplifies the steps).

Security statement

Because the GITHUB_TOKEN generated in workflows that triggered by pull_request_target event has write permissions, we need to avoid malicious damage to the repo by the PR author.

  1. Set permissions to different jobs: as the first job would run js scripts which could be modified by PR authors, set the permission of this job to read-all (as we still need the GITHUB_TOKEN to access some resouces).
  2. The pull_request_target event would trigger the workflow runs with the main version of workflows (including the shared workflows - "PR review companion"). This has been tested by Onkar - yin1999#6, and has been documented by GitHub Docs:

    Although the workflow runs in the context of the base of the pull request, you should make sure that you do not check out, build, or run untrusted code from the pull request with this event.

  3. The workflow triggered by pull_request_target event could also access GitHub secrets. But GitHub Actions can only read a secret if you explicitly include the secret in a workflow.

Related issues and pull requests

implementation of: #28579 (comment)
items.title: refactor(ci/pr-review): use `workflow_call` instead of `workflow_run` event
